usefulItems: brownie tin (32 cm x 18 cm), refrigerator, oven
title: Sweet Potato Brownies

ingredients.content: 500 g sweet potatoes, cut in pieces
130 g dark chocolate (50% cocoa solids), small pieces or callets
30 g coconut oil, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Drain coconut milk separating solid cream from milk, collecting both in separate bowls (see tip).
<b>Insert butterfly whisk.<b> Place agave syrup and reserved coconut cream in mixing bowl then mix <b>20 sec/speed 2<b>. Transfer to a bowl then set aside in fridge.
Preheat oven to 180°C and grease a brownie tin (approx. 32 cm x 18 cm).
Place buckwheat in mixing bowl and grind <b>20 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer to a bowl.
Place almonds in mixing bowl and grind <b>7 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to bowl with buckwheat and set aside.

Place water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh in sweet potatoes then steam <b>20 min/100°C/speed 4<b>. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and transfer cooked potatoes to a bowl. Discard cooking water.
Place dates, chocolate, oil, rice milk and cocoa in mixing bowl then grind <b>20 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add reserved sweet potatoes and chop <b>30 sec/speed 9<b>, while stirring with spatula through hole in mixing bowl lid.

Add baking powder, salt, reserved almonds and buckwheat then mix <b>20 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer to prepared tin and bake for 25 minutes (180°C). Allow to cool in tin before removing and cutting into squares. Serve with reserved whipped coconut cream.

hintsAndTricks: Agave syrup is sweeter than sugar meaning a smaller amount is needed.
Place the tin of coconut milk in the fridge for at least <b>8 hours<b> before beginning the recipe. After this time, drain liquid part and solid part from milk.
The reserved coconut milk can be added to smoothies or juices for extra flavour.
